The estimated probability of the player winning the game, based on a Monte Carlo simulation with 5000 outcomes and the given rules, is approximately 74.1%. 

Comparing this to the provided choices:
a) <60%
b) 60%-65%
c) 65%-70%
d) >70%

The correct choice is d) >70%.

The average number of rolls per game, based on the Monte Carlo simulation of 5000 games, is approximately 2.88 rolls. Therefore, the correct choice for the average number of rolls per game is b) 2.7 – 2.9.
The new probability of the player winning the game when 8 and 9 are included as losing numbers only for the initial roll is approximately 43.7%. Therefore, the correct answer choice is a) <50%.
